Course Info: Describe what relational databases are, and how they are used.Master the Relational Database Model.Demonstrate comprehensive SQL skills. Data Model, Relational Algebra, Relational Database, SQL, Database Theory Module 1: Database Overview, Module 2: Relational Algebra, Module 3: SQL, Summative Course Assessment  DataScience
Course Info Translate: Relational databases are a type of database that stores and organizes data in tables with rows and columns. They are used to efficiently manage and retrieve data in a structured way. To master the Relational Database Model, one must understand the concepts of Data Model, Relational Algebra, Relational Database, and SQL. This includes having comprehensive SQL skills to manipulate and query data effectively. The course modules cover Database Overview, Relational Algebra, and SQL, with a final assessment to test understanding of the material.

Course Title: Health Behavior Change: From Evidence to Action
Course Info: Identify social, behavioral, and psychological factors that influence health and health care.Inform clinical care, public health programs, and health policy through results of empirical studies.Utilize best practices from clinical psychology and public health to make informed health decisions and to optimize health behaviors.Apply theory, methods, and research results in the social and behavioral sciences to public health practice and policy. health practices, health psychology, Mental Health, Public Health, behavioral psychology Welcome to the course, Nutrition Part 1, Nutrition Part 2, Physical Activity Part 1, Physical Activity Part 2, Mental Health Part 1, Mental Health Part 2, Conclusion Health
Course Info Translate: This text discusses the importance of identifying social, behavioral, and psychological factors that influence health and healthcare. It emphasizes the need to inform clinical care, public health programs, and health policy through empirical studies. The text also highlights the importance of utilizing best practices from clinical psychology and public health to make informed health decisions and optimize health behaviors. It encourages the application of theory, methods, and research results in the social and behavioral sciences to public health practice and policy. The course covers topics such as health practices, health psychology, mental health, and behavioral psychology, as well as specific modules on nutrition, physical activity, and mental health.
Course Title Translate: Health Behavior Change: From Evidence to Action

Course Info: Assess  the current and potential role for integrative therapies in health and healthcare, including your own workplace.Discuss the evidence base for use of integrative therapies, including the historical, clinical, and research data.    Assess if a therapy is appropriate, Educate patients about  benefit and risk, Administer or advise on use, and Evaluate if the therapy was useful.Partner with patients to incorporate integrative therapies for specific symptom management or enhanced health and wellbeing.     improved symptom management, patient-centered care, wellbeing, evidence-based practice, integrative medicine Introduction to Integrative Therapies and Healing Practices, Guided Imagery, Herbal Medicine, Aromatherapy: Clinical Use of Essential Oils, Mindfulness in Integrative Healthcare Health
Course Info Translate: Assess the current and potential role of integrative therapies in health and healthcare, including in your own workplace. Discuss the evidence supporting the use of integrative therapies, including historical, clinical, and research data. Evaluate if a therapy is appropriate, educate patients about the benefits and risks, administer or advise on its use, and assess its effectiveness. Collaborate with patients to incorporate integrative therapies for specific symptom management or to enhance health and wellbeing. This approach can lead to improved symptom management, patient-centered care, wellbeing, evidence-based practice, and integrative medicine. Some examples of integrative therapies include Introduction to Integrative Therapies and Healing Practices, Guided Imagery, Herbal Medicine, Aromatherapy: Clinical Use of Essential Oils, and Mindfulness in Integrative Healthcare.

Course Info: Design a qualitative research project to respond to specific public health problems or questions.Design strategies and instruments for qualitative data collection that are linked to study objectives and appropriate for the population of interest.Define objectives for an analysis project using specific analytic tools and processes with MAXQDA software.Evaluate qualitative research reports in public health or social and behavioral sciences. Course Info Translate: Designing a qualitative research project to address specific public health issues or questions involves creating strategies and tools for data collection that align with the study's goals and are suitable for the target population. Defining objectives for data analysis using specific analytic tools and processes with MAXQDA software is essential. Evaluating qualitative research reports in public health or social and behavioral sciences is also important. Key areas to focus on include research methods, data analysis, research design, qualitative research, public health research, qualitative research design, qualitative data collection methods, and qualitative data analysis using MAXQDA software.

Course Title: Addressing Racial Health Inequity in Healthcare Specialization
Course Info: Recognize the historical backdrop that created disproportionate disease burden within racial/ethnic groups. Explain factors within the structure and delivery of healthcare that cause racial and ethnic disparities in health status and outcomes. Critically appraise approaches to address racial inequity in healthcare, all within the US and international contexts. healthcare, Healthcare Equity, Publicly Funded Health Care History of Racial Inequity in Healthcare, Causes of Racial Inequity in Healthcare, Achieving Health Equity in Healthcare Health
Course Info Translate: Recognize the historical context that has led to a disproportionate burden of disease within racial and ethnic groups. Explain the factors in the healthcare system that contribute to disparities in health outcomes based on race and ethnicity. Critically evaluate strategies to address racial inequities in healthcare, both in the United States and internationally. Topics include healthcare equity, publicly funded healthcare, the history of racial inequity in healthcare, causes of racial inequity in healthcare, and achieving health equity in healthcare.

Course Info: Play with 50 algorithmic puzzles on your smartphone to develop your algorithmic intuition!  Apply algorithmic techniques (greedy algorithms, binary search, dynamic programming, etc.) and data structures (stacks, queues, trees, graphs, etc.) to solve 100 programming challenges that often appear at interviews at high-tech companies. Get an instant feedback on whether your solution is correct.Apply the newly learned algorithms to solve real-world challenges: navigating in a Big Network  or assembling a genome of a deadly pathogen from millions of short substrings of its DNA.Learn exactly the same material as undergraduate students in “Algorithms 101” at top universities and more! We are excited that students from various parts of the world are now studying our online materials in the Algorithms 101 classes at their universities. Here is a quote from the website of Professor Sauleh EetemadiOpens in a new tab from Iran University of Science and Technology: “After examining syllabus and course material from top universities including StanfordOpens in a new tab, PrincetonOpens in a new tab and MITOpens in a new tab we have chosen to follow the Data Structures and Algorithms SpecializationOpens in a new tab from UCSD...due to excellent course material and its practical approach.”If you decide to venture beyond Algorithms 101, try to solve more complex programming challenges (flows in networks, linear programming, streaming algorithms, etc.) and complete an equivalent of a graduate course in algorithms! Software Testing, Data Structure, Computer Programming, Algorithms, Debugging Algorithmic Toolbox, Data Structures, Algorithms on Graphs, Algorithms on Strings, Advanced Algorithms and Complexity, Genome Assembly Programming Challenge Health

Course Info: Describe the impact of structural racism on individuals.Identify and discuss how historical events, policies and socio-political institutions have shaped and contributed to current health inequities.Apply public writing strategies to work against racial inequities in health. healthcare, Inequities Course Introduction & Policy, Politics, and Racial Health Inequities, Historical Roots of Health Inequities, State Violence and Health Inequities  Health
Course Info Translate: Structural racism has a significant impact on individuals. Historical events, policies, and socio-political institutions have played a role in shaping and contributing to current health inequities. To combat racial inequities in health, it is important to apply public writing strategies. This includes understanding the historical roots of health inequities, the impact of state violence on health inequities, and the intersection of policy, politics, and racial health inequities.
Course Title Translate: Structural Racism: Causes of Health Inequities in the U.S.

Course Title: Linear Regression in R for Public Health
Course Info: Describe when a linear regression model is appropriate to useRead in and check a data set's variables using the software R prior to undertaking a model analysis    Fit a multiple linear regression model with interactions, check model assumptions and interpret the output      Correlation And Dependence, Linear Regression, R Programming INTRODUCTION TO LINEAR REGRESSION, Linear Regression in R, Multiple Regression and Interaction, MODEL BUILDING Health
Course Info Translate: A linear regression model is appropriate to use when you want to analyze the relationship between two or more variables and determine if there is a linear relationship between them. In order to do this, you should read in and check a data set's variables using the software R before undertaking a model analysis. You should then fit a multiple linear regression model with interactions, check the model assumptions, and interpret the output. This process involves understanding correlation and dependence, linear regression, and using R programming. It is important to build and analyze models in order to gain insights into health-related data.
Course Title Translate: Linear Regression in R for Public Health

Course Info: What syndemics is and how it was developed.How to quantitatively identify if health and social conditions cluster and whether an interaction leads to a higher burden of disease than expected.How qualitative research can be used to explore syndemics.How you can combine qualitative approaches with quantitative research methods to gain a more comprehensive understanding of a syndemic. Mixed Method Research, Qualitative Research, interviewing, quantitative research Welcome to Leiden University, Syndemic Theory, Interaction in Syndemics, Context in Syndemics, Mixed methods Health
Course Info Translate: Syndemics is a term used to describe the clustering of health and social conditions, and how they interact to create a higher burden of disease than expected. This concept was developed to quantitatively identify these clusters and interactions. Qualitative research can also be used to explore syndemics in more depth. By combining qualitative and quantitative research methods, a more comprehensive understanding of syndemics can be gained. This approach, known as mixed method research, involves techniques such as interviewing and quantitative analysis. Welcome to Leiden University, where Syndemic Theory, Interaction in Syndemics, Context in Syndemics, and Mixed Methods Health are studied.

Análisis del sistema de salud, análisis de la Organización Mundial de la Salud, Comportamiento organizacional, estrategia organizacional. Fundamentos de los sistemas de salud comparativos, Estados Unidos - Un país de ingresos altos sin atención médica universal, Alemania e Inglaterra - Sistemas de atención médica autónomos, Brasil y China - Países de ingresos medios que avanzan hacia la cobertura universal de salud.

Course Title: Causes of Racial Inequity in Healthcare
Course Info: What constitutes access to care, how geographic variation in healthcare contributes to racial and ethnic healthcare disparitiesHistory of mistreatment of racial and ethnic groups within biomedical innovation and healthcare systemsThe role of implicit bias in contributing to healthcare disparities healthcare bias, Healthcare Equity, Healthcare access, Healthcare disparities Week 1 | Financing of Healthcare, Week 2 | Issues of Access to Care and Healthcare Disparities, Week 3 | Mistreatment of Racial/Ethnic Groups, Week 4 | The Role of Race in the Practice of Medicine, Week 5 | Implicit Bias in Healthcare Treatment Health
Course Info Translate: The text discusses the factors that determine access to healthcare, how differences in healthcare availability across geographic regions contribute to racial and ethnic healthcare disparities, the history of mistreatment of racial and ethnic groups in biomedical innovation and healthcare systems, and the role of implicit bias in creating healthcare disparities. It also outlines the topics covered in each week of a course on healthcare, including financing, access to care, mistreatment of racial/ethnic groups, the role of race in medicine, and implicit bias in healthcare treatment.
Course Title Translate: Causes of Racial Inequity in Healthcare

Course Info: Prepare healthcare clinicians and administrators for Value-Based Care (VBC) reimbursement and operating models.Explore the power of effective communication between healthcare professionals and patients that leads to a partnership focused on quality care.Develop an understanding of your individual responsibility to lead from where you are  to advance a culture of collaboration focused on VBC. healthcare, Leadership, value-based care, social determinants of health, Population Health Value-Based Care: Introduction to Value-Based Care and the U.S. Healthcare System, Value-Based Care: Population Health, Value-Based Care: Managing Processes to Improve Outcomes, Value-Based Care: Reimbursement Models, Value-Based Care: Organizational Competencies, Value-Based Care: Quality Improvement in Organizations, Value-Based Care: Capstone Project Health
Course Info Translate: Prepare healthcare providers and administrators for Value-Based Care (VBC) reimbursement and operating models. Explore the importance of effective communication between healthcare professionals and patients in order to establish a partnership focused on quality care. Gain an understanding of your individual responsibility to lead in promoting a culture of collaboration centered on VBC. Topics include healthcare, leadership, value-based care, social determinants of health, population health, introduction to Value-Based Care and the U.S. healthcare system, managing processes to improve outcomes, reimbursement models, organizational competencies, quality improvement in organizations, and a capstone project on Value-Based Care.

Course Info: The scope and role of palliative care as part of a patient and family's care planComponents of a treatment plan for physical, psychosocial, and spiritual care, including screening, assessment and management of patient needs     Effective communication skills for responding to emotion, delivering difficult news, and discussing goals of careIssues around transitions in care (e.g. survivorship or hospice transition)   Effective Communication, Palliative Care, Symptom Assessment and Management, Transition to Hospice, Supportive Care Essentials of Palliative Care, Symptom Management in Palliative Care, Transitions in Care from Survivorship to Hospice, Supporting Families and Caregivers, Palliative Care Always Capstone Course Health
Course Info Translate: The scope and role of palliative care as part of a patient and family's care plan include components of a treatment plan for physical, psychosocial, and spiritual care, including screening, assessment, and management of patient needs. Effective communication skills are necessary for responding to emotions, delivering difficult news, and discussing goals of care. Issues around transitions in care, such as survivorship or hospice transition, are also important. Other topics covered in the course include symptom assessment and management, transition to hospice, supportive care essentials of palliative care, symptom management in palliative care, transitions in care from survivorship to hospice, supporting families and caregivers, and the importance of palliative care.

Course Title: Severe to Profound Intellectual Disability: Circles of Care and Education
Course Info: Empowering all the people who work in a team to care and educate children with severe to profound intellectual disabilityConsidering lifelong learning by exploring brain development, the learning process, and how to maximise the opportunities for learning.How you can support children with severe to profound intellectual disability so that they can reach their full potential.   Intellectual Disability Education, caregiving, Lifelong Learning, Facilitating Learning, Educating children with intellectual disability Who is the child with severe to profound intellectual disability? , Lifelong learning, Facilitating learning, Rights, advocacy and relationships of care Health
Course Info Translate: Empowering all team members who work together to care for and educate children with severe to profound intellectual disabilities. This includes considering lifelong learning through exploring brain development, the learning process, and how to maximize learning opportunities. It also involves supporting children with severe to profound intellectual disabilities so they can reach their full potential. This includes education, caregiving, lifelong learning, facilitating learning, and advocating for the rights and relationships of care for children with intellectual disabilities.
Course Title Translate: Severe to Profound Intellectual Disability: Circles of Care and Education

Course Title: Inclusión social de personas con discapacidad desde un enfoque de derechos.
Course Info: Reflexionar sobre el enfoque de Derechos consagrado en la Convención de Naciones Unidas sobre Derechos de las Personas con Discapacidad Conocer las diferencias conceptuales entre modelos, enfoques y teorías en el ámbito de la discapacidad en su proceso de tránsito conceptual Tomar decisiones sociales, laborales o profesionales que incorporen el enfoque de derechos hacia personas en situación de discapacidad.Analizar estándares de accesibilidad en la provisión de servicios a personas en situación de discapacidad Not specified Bienvenida al curso, Introducción a la comprensión de la discapacidad en el mundo, Discapacidad, tránsito conceptual hacia un enfoque de derecho, Caracterización y prevalencia de la discapacidad en el mundo, Principios de accesibilidad, Autonomía, Salud inclusiva, Educación inclusiva, Inclusión laboral, Evaluación final del curso Health
Course Info Translate:
Reflecting on the Rights-based approach enshrined in the United Nations Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities
Understanding the conceptual differences between models, approaches, and theories in the field of disability in its conceptual transition process
Making social, work, or professional decisions that incorporate a rights-based approach towards people with disabilities
Analyzing accessibility standards in the provision of services to people with disabilities
Welcome to the course, Introduction to understanding disability in the world, Disability, conceptual transition towards a rights-based approach, Characterization and prevalence of disability in the world, Principles of accessibility, Autonomy, Inclusive health, Inclusive education, Inclusive employment, Final course evaluation.
Course Title Translate: Social inclusion of people with disabilities from a rights-based approach.

This course covers topics such as an introduction to qualitative research, qualitative methods, objective-driven design, methods, population, sampling, recruitment, research ethics, and examples of health-related projects and designs.

Course Title: Aromatherapy: Clinical Use of Essential Oils
Course Info: Describe the current and potential role of aromatherapy in health and healthcare.Identify safety and ethical issues and discuss their application in practice situations.Assess, administer, and evaluate the use of essential oils for management of pain, anxiety, nausea, and fatigue.Discuss logistics of establishing and sustaining a clinical aromatherapy program. improved symptom management, patient-centered care, wellbeing, evidence-based practice, integrative healthcare What is Aromatherapy and its Role in Health and Healthcare?, What Do I Need to Know About Safety and Quality?, Application and Delivery Methods, Essential Oils for Managing Pain and Anxiety, Essential Oils for Managing Nausea and Fatigue, Peer Review Project, Establishing and Sustaining a Clinical  Aromatherapy Program Health
Course Info Translate:
Aromatherapy is the use of essential oils extracted from plants to promote health and well-being. Its current role in health and healthcare includes improving symptom management, providing patient-centered care, and promoting overall well-being. Aromatherapy can be used in conjunction with traditional medical treatments to enhance their effectiveness.

The potential role of aromatherapy in health and healthcare is vast, with ongoing research exploring its benefits in various conditions such as pain management, anxiety reduction, nausea relief, and fatigue management. Evidence-based practice is essential in determining the efficacy of aromatherapy in these areas.

Safety and ethical issues are important considerations when using aromatherapy in healthcare settings. It is crucial to ensure the quality and purity of essential oils, as well as to consider any potential interactions with medications or existing medical conditions. Practitioners must also adhere to ethical guidelines in their practice, respecting patient autonomy and informed consent.

In practice situations, healthcare providers must assess the individual needs of patients, administer essential oils appropriately, and evaluate their effectiveness in managing symptoms. This may involve using different delivery methods such as inhalation, topical application, or massage.

Establishing and sustaining a clinical aromatherapy program requires careful planning and coordination. This includes developing protocols for the use of essential oils, training healthcare staff in aromatherapy techniques, and ensuring ongoing evaluation of the program's effectiveness. Integrating aromatherapy into existing healthcare practices can lead to improved patient outcomes and satisfaction.
Course Title Translate: Aromatherapy: Clinical Use of Essential Oils

Course Info: Explain why ethical practices are important in scientific research.Describe guidelines researchers follow for conducting ethical research. Explain necessary components for conducting ethical research with human participants.Explain necessary components for conducting ethical research with nonhuman animals.Describe issues associated with research misconduct.Evaluate ethical issues in research. Psychology, History, Political Science, Ethics, Research And Design Learn With PsycLearn Essentials, Introduction to Ethics in Psychology, Background and History, Codes and Enforcement, Ethical Standards for Using Nonhuman Animals in Research, Ethical Standards for Using Humans in Research, Analysis and Reporting of Research, Cumulative Check Your Understanding: Case Studies in Research Ethics, Conclusion, Course Assessment, PsycLearn Essentials APA Student Resources Health
Course Info Translate:
Ethical practices are important in scientific research to ensure the protection and well-being of participants, maintain the integrity of the research process, and uphold public trust in the scientific community. Researchers follow guidelines such as obtaining informed consent, ensuring confidentiality, minimizing harm, and obtaining ethical approval from institutional review boards.

For conducting ethical research with human participants, necessary components include obtaining informed consent, protecting confidentiality, minimizing harm, ensuring voluntary participation, and obtaining ethical approval from institutional review boards.

For conducting ethical research with nonhuman animals, necessary components include minimizing harm, using appropriate methods of data collection, ensuring proper care and housing of animals, and obtaining ethical approval from animal care and use committees.

Issues associated with research misconduct include data fabrication, plagiarism, conflicts of interest, and violations of ethical guidelines. It is important to evaluate and address these ethical issues in research to maintain the credibility and validity of scientific findings.

The course "PsycLearn Essentials: Introduction to Ethics in Psychology" covers topics such as background and history of research ethics, codes and enforcement of ethical standards, ethical standards for using nonhuman animals and humans in research, analysis and reporting of research, case studies in research ethics, and a course assessment. APA student resources are also available for further learning and support in research ethics.

Course Title: Lymphoedema: Monitoring & Intervention After Breast Cancer
Course Info: Describe the prospective surveillance and early intervention model of care and outline how to implement this model across healthcare settings  Explain the range of clinical assessments used to detect early breast cancer related lymphoedemaExplain why a multidisciplinary treatment approach may improve survivorship for those diagnosed with breast cancer Anatomy, Research, clinical treatment, physiology, clinical assessment Course Overview, Introduction to Lymphoedema , Lymphatic Physiology, Lymphatic Anatomy, Assessment & Treatment, Case Studies Health
Course Info Translate: The text describes a model of care that involves surveillance and early intervention for breast cancer-related lymphedema. It outlines how to implement this model in various healthcare settings. It also explains the different clinical assessments used to detect early signs of breast cancer-related lymphedema. Additionally, it discusses how a multidisciplinary treatment approach can improve survivorship for those diagnosed with breast cancer. The course covers topics such as anatomy, research, clinical treatment, physiology, clinical assessment, introduction to lymphedema, lymphatic physiology, lymphatic anatomy, assessment and treatment, and case studies.
Course Title Translate: Lymphoedema: Monitoring & Intervention After Breast Cancer

Course Title: Value-Based Care: Managing Processes to Improve Outcomes
Course Info: Describe the importance of managing office-based processes for improving patient outcomes and experience, as well as clinical quality.Describe the importance of managing supporting functions for improving patient outcomes and experience, as well as clinical quality.Formulate a basic understanding of the relationship between managing processes and supporting functions to improve patient outcomes and experience. Health Education, Patient Care, Office Processes, value-based healthcare, Public Health Introduction to Managing Office Processes in a Value-Based Care Practice, Supporting Functions to Improve Outcomes, Course Project: Making This My Own Health
Course Info Translate:
The importance of managing office-based processes for improving patient outcomes and experience, as well as clinical quality, is crucial in ensuring efficient and effective healthcare delivery. By streamlining administrative tasks and ensuring smooth operations within the office setting, healthcare providers can focus more on delivering high-quality care to patients. This ultimately leads to better patient outcomes and a more positive overall experience for patients.

Similarly, managing supporting functions such as IT systems, billing, and supply chain management is also essential for improving patient outcomes and experience. By optimizing these functions, healthcare organizations can ensure that resources are allocated efficiently and that patients receive timely and appropriate care.

Understanding the relationship between managing processes and supporting functions is key to improving patient outcomes and experience. By aligning these two aspects of healthcare management, providers can create a more cohesive and patient-centered approach to care delivery. This can ultimately lead to better outcomes for patients and a more positive experience within the healthcare system.
Course Title Translate: Value-Based Care: Managing Processes to Improve Outcomes

Course Info Translate:
Module 1: Normal Sinus Anatomy and Function
This module will describe the normal anatomy and function of the sinuses.

Module 2: Acute Rhinosinusitis: Diagnosis and Treatment
This module will explain the difference between acute and chronic rhinosinusitis and provide appropriate diagnosis and treatment for severe and non-severe acute rhinosinusitis.

Module 3: Chronic Rhinosinusitis: Diagnosis and Treatment
This module will identify the indications for sinus surgery and assess the potential complications of endoscopic sinus surgery.

Module 4: The Role of Surgery for Sinusitis
This module will focus on chronic rhinosinusitis, surgery, acute rhinosinusitis, and diagnostic evaluation.

Course Info Translate: There are several approaches for selecting and scoping a patient safety or quality improvement project. One can compare and contrast QI/PI approaches such as A3 Thinking, Design Thinking, and Translating Research into Practice (TRiP). It is important to create a project charter or A3 using SMART goals. Additionally, it is essential to explain the usage of various root cause identification tools throughout the project. These tools include Project Management, Design Thinking, Quality Improvement Project Selection Strategy and Tools You Can Use, A3 Thinking, Translating Research Into Practice, and Design Thinking Health.

Course Title: Diagnóstico y tratamiento del dolor neuropático en atención primaria
Course Info: 1. Identificar las implicaciones del diagnóstico oportuno del dolor neuropático y sus implicaciones en salud pública.2. Identificar los componentes esenciales del interrogatorio y examen físico del paciente con sospecha de dolor neuropático.3. Identificar y usar herramientas que permitan establecer diagnósticos asociados con el dolor neuropático en cada tipo de patología.4. Identificar la primera línea de tratamiento, en patologías como dolor lumbar con radiculopatía, neuralgia postherpética y neuropatía diabética. Evaluar a un paciente, Escucha activa, Examinar a pacientes, Formular medicamentos, Diagnosticar a pacientes Bienvenida, El dolor neuropático: qué es y cuál es su magnitud, El dolor lumbar, Neuralgia postherpética, Polineuropatía diabética dolorosa (PDD) Health
Course Info Translate:
1. Identify the implications of timely diagnosis of neuropathic pain and its implications in public health.
2. Identify the essential components of the interview and physical examination of patients with suspected neuropathic pain.
3. Identify and use tools that allow for establishing diagnoses associated with neuropathic pain in each type of pathology.
4. Identify the first line of treatment in pathologies such as low back pain with radiculopathy, postherpetic neuralgia, and diabetic neuropathy. Evaluate a patient, Active listening, Examining patients, Prescribing medications, Diagnosing patients Welcome, Neuropathic pain: what it is and its magnitude, Low back pain, Postherpetic neuralgia, Painful diabetic polyneuropathy (PDP) Health
Course Title Translate: Diagnosis and treatment of neuropathic pain in primary care

Course Title: The Big Stuff: Evolution and Ecology
Course Info: Explain why biodiversity is important and how evolution works to generate biodiversity. Explain the basic principles of ecology and discuss how we fit into an ecological system.Apply knowledge of ecology to current conservation issues in today’s society. Identify costs/benefits to each conservation strategy. Not specified The "E" Word, The Diversity of Life, The Interconnectedness of Life , Questions of Conservation: Finding Balance  Health
Course Info Translate:
Biodiversity is important because it allows ecosystems to function properly and provides a variety of resources for humans. Evolution works by creating new species through genetic variation and natural selection, which increases biodiversity over time. The basic principles of ecology include the interactions between organisms and their environment, energy flow, and nutrient cycling. Humans are a part of ecological systems and must consider how their actions impact the environment.

Applying knowledge of ecology to conservation issues involves understanding how human activities can harm ecosystems and species. Conservation strategies aim to protect and restore biodiversity, but they also come with costs and benefits. It is important to find a balance between conservation efforts and human needs. The books "The 'E' Word," "The Diversity of Life," "The Interconnectedness of Life," and "Questions of Conservation: Finding Balance Health" discuss these topics in more detail.
Course Title Translate: The Big Stuff: Evolution and Ecology
